attributes.action: Make GP practices fully resume pre covid services face to face appointments etc
attributes.additional_details: Extremely difficult to make appointments or speak to receptionist / dr via telephone. My daughter couldn’t get appointments, could not see a GP face to face and her diagnosis and treatment of a brain tumour was delayed due to this, putting her life at risk. People’s lives are being put at risk due to skeleton staff and reduced services.
attributes.background: Go back to normal opening times. Allow people to walk in to speak to receptionists face to face. Resume face to face appointments. Resume full staffing levels and offer all pre covid services. Resume advance appointment making system.

rejection.details:
Decisions relating to GP appointments, including decisions on whether face-to-face appointments are appropriate, are operational matters for the NHS and individual GPs, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You might like to sign this petition which calls for a related action:

Create a legal right for patients to receive timely face-to-face GP appointments: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/587701
